intro: Stephanomeria suksdorfii, commonly known as the Suksdorf's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the United States, specifically found in California. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-centered flowers that bloom in late summer. It has hairy, glandular leaves and produces small, round seed pods. Stephanomeria suksdorfii is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
